questions.question: Janet and Peter are getting married. I heard it straight from the ....................... mouth.
questions.description: Straight from the horse's mouth means from the most reliable source of information.

questions.question: I wanted the party to be a secret but my sister let the ......................... out of the bag.
questions.description: To let the cat out of the bag is to reveal a secret by mistake.

questions.question: The moment she started ....................... me up, I knew that she wanted to gain a favor.
questions.description: To butter someone up is the praise them.

questions.question: The two brothers are always pulling each other's .........................
questions.description: To pull someone's leg is to tease them.

questions.question: Don't trust him. He is a ........................ in sheep's clothing.
questions.description: A wolf in sheep's clothing is a dangerous person who pretends to be harmless.

questions.question: He won the race ...................... down.
questions.description: When you manage to do something hands down you accomplish it without a lot of effort.

questions.question: By taking action against him for your failure you are just .................. up the wrong tree.
questions.description: To bark up the wrong tree is to pursue a misguided course of action.

questions.question: Don't try to make fun of him. He ........................... off the handle pretty easily.
questions.description: To fly off the handle is to become very angry.

questions.question: That laptop cost me ...................
questions.description: If something costs you an arm and a leg, it is very expensive.

questions.question: I hate having to tell him what I really think of him but I have to ............................ the bullet now.
questions.description: To bite the bullet is to force yourself to do something unpleasant.

questions.question: The indulgent mother turns a ...................... to her son's faults.
The enemy was armed to the .................... yet our soldiers managed to beat them.
questions.description: When you are armed to the teeth, you are extremely well equipped.
